list-item.p: Alphavirus transmitted by anopheline mosquitoes in sub-Saharan Africa.
Typically reported in large epidemics with high attack rates.
Fever and severe symmetric arthralgias are nearly universal. Pruritic maculopapular rash is common.
Lymphadenitis (especially posterior cervical) is common but not universal.
Diagnosis is by polymerase chain reaction (PCR) in the first 3 days or by serology.
Treatment is supportive, with acute symptoms resolving in 5 to 7 days.
